items.title: Viral apple cider vinegar weight loss study retracted for flawed science
bullets: • BMJ Group has retracted research suggesting that small daily quantities of apple cider vinegar might help people who are overweight or obese to lose weight
• The small clinical trial was published in the open access journal BMJ Nutrition, Prevention & Health in March 2024 and its findings press released

items.title: That annoying SMS phish you just got may have come from a box like this
bullets: • Scammers have been abusing unsecured cellular routers used in industrial settings to blast SMS-based phishing messages in campaigns that have been ongoing since 2023, researchers say
• The routers are rugged Internet of Things devices that use cellular networks to connect traffic lights, electric power meters, and other sorts of remote industrial devices to central hubs

items.title: Megafauna was the meat of choice for South American hunters
bullets: • Archaeologists examined animal bones at sites dating to the waning years of the last Ice Age
• They found evidence that people butchered giant sloths, giant armadillos, and elephant-like creatures were on the menu for hunters in South America

items.title: OpenAI mocks Musk’s math in suit over iPhone/ChatGPT integration
bullets: • Apple and OpenAI are fighting to block OpenAI from using ChatGPT to compete with Apple's ChatGPS
• The company says it will only have access to "a small fraction of the potential market" of potential users
• OpenAI and Apple argue that this gives them access to a portion of the market for new features

items.title: Four ways this US government shutdown could end
bullets: • US Senate was unable to pass a spending bill that would have kept the US government funded, and for the first time in nearly seven years, federal operations have been drastically curtailed
• At some point, this shutdown – like all the ones before it - will end

items.title: Violence breaks out in Morocco as anti-government protests rage for fourth day
bullets: • Anti-government demonstrations gripped Morocco for the fourth night in a row as young people filled the streets of cities and destruction and violence broke out in several places
• The “Gen Z” demonstrations mirror similar unrest sweeping countries such as Nepal and Madagascar
• Dozens of peaceful protesters were arrested over the weekend

items.title: Jane Goodall, legendary primatologist, has died at age 91
bullets: • Jane Goodall, a scientist whose studies of wild chimpanzees made her a household name, has died at the age of 91
• Her groundbreaking discoveries showed just how much chimps are like humans
• "They kiss, embrace, hold hands, pat one another on the back," Goodall said

items.title: The billion-year reign of fungi that predated plants and made Earth livable
bullets: • Fungi may have shaped Earth’s landscapes long before plants appeared
• They may have partnered with algae, recycling nutrients, breaking down rock, and creating primitive ecosystems
• The discovery could help explain the origin of life in the world's most complex ecosystems

items.title: This ultra-thin solar tech could power everything from phones to skyscrapers
bullets: • Researchers at Chalmers University of Technology in Sweden unraveled the structure of a promising solar material using machine learning and advanced simulations
• Their findings could unlock durable, ultra-efficient solar cells for a rapidly electrifying world
• Solar cells could be so thin and flexible that they could encase anything from mobile phones to skyscrapers

items.title: Before they sucked blood, leeches were ocean hunters
bullets: • A 430-million-year-old fossil reveals leeches began as ocean hunters long before they evolved into bloodsuckers
• Unlike today’s bloodsucking leeches, their ancient ancestors likely hunted small marine animals using a tail sucker rather than piercing skin

items.title: Why scientists are using corals from other countries to help save Florida's reefs
bullets: • Scientists are breeding corals from Florida, Honduras and the Cayman Islands to combat climate change
• Over the past two years, 80% of the world's reefs saw dangerous levels of heat, which causes coral to bleach
• Florida coral has been crossbred with coral from Honduras, creating what researchers call "Flonduran" corals

items.title: Former DRC president Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
bullets: • A court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the former president to death in absentia
• The case stems from his alleged role in backing the advance of M23 rebels in DRC’s eastern provinces
• He was also ordered to pay about $50bn in damages to the state and victims

items.title: Trump touts shutdown as 'unprecedented opportunity' to cut 'Democrat Agencies'
bullets: • President Donald Trump says Democrats gave him an "unprecedented opportunity" to slash government agencies
• Trump says he will soon meet with the director of the Office of Management and Budget to determine which of the many Democrat Agencies he recommends to be cut
• The two men will also weigh "whether or not those cuts will be temporary or permanent"

items.title: Trump to meet with Project 2025 architect on cutting ‘Democrat agendas’ amid government shutdown – live
bullets: • Donald Trump is meeting with the White House to find out if he will continue to pursue his dream of being a Democrat
• The White House has already started a series of projects in New York City, New York, that will be the first of its kind
• The president has pledged to spend $1billion on infrastructure projects

items.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says U.S. GDP could take a hit from the government shutdown
bullets: • Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says government shutdown could hurt U.S
• economic growth
• The shutdown has yet to come to an agreement on a continuing resolution that would allow spending and operations to proceed
• Gross domestic product rose at a 3.8% annualized pace in the second quarter

items.title: Taiwan rejects U.S. proposal for '50-50' chip production, says trade talks focused on tariffs
bullets: • Taiwan will not accept Washington's proposal to locally manufacture half the chips it currently supplies to the U.S., the island's top trade negotiator said
• Cheng Li-chiun, also the country's vice premier, said the proposal for a "50-50" split in semiconductor production was not discussed

items.title: Berkshire Hathaway to buy Occidental's OxyChem for $9.7 billion, in Buffett's biggest deal in three years
bullets: • Berkshire Hathaway buys Occidental Petroleum's petrochemical unit OxyChem for $9.7 billion in cash
• The deal marks Berkshire's largest since 2022, when it paid $11.6 billion for insurer Alleghany
• Buffett, who is 95, has said he wouldn't take complete control of the Houston-based oil company

items.title: Husband of judge who blocked ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ shutdown has ties to DeSantis
bullets: • Judge Barbara Lagoa is married to Paul Huck, a senior figure in Tallahassee-based law firm Lawson Huck Gonzalez
• Law firm has secured more than $10m in state contracts since it was founded in 2023
• It represents the DeSantis administration in a lawsuit against Target over its 2023 Pride campaign

items.title: How the White House used studies with ‘weak’ evidence to tie Tylenol to autism
bullets: • White House press release links to studies showing link to Tylenol causes autism
• The link is made to look like two separate studies, one from Harvard and one from Mount Sinai
• The release creates the appearance of extra evidence by linking to the same studies multiple times, experts say

items.title: Israel intercepts Gaza flotilla and detains activists including Greta Thunberg
bullets: • Israel intercepts Gaza flotilla and detains activists including Greta Thunberg
• Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF) was carrying aid bound for Gaza
• Group said Israel's response was "not an act of defence", but "a brazen act of desperation"

items.title: Woman says she spoke with Michigan church shooter amid attack and ‘he let me live’
bullets: • Lisa Louis, 45, says she was able to look into the gunman's soul during the chaos
• She said she instantly forgave him “with my heart” Thomas “Jake” Sanford, 40, rammed his pickup truck into the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints chapel in Grand Blanc Township, Michigan
• Friends said Sanford had expressed hatred toward the Mormon church after living in Utah

items.title: Attenborough and Prince William lead tributes to Dr Jane Goodall
bullets: • Dr Goodall died while in California on a speaking tour of the US
• Prince William said she "transformed our understanding of the natural world" Sir David Attenborough and Prince of Wales said she was a "traveller" of the world

items.title: Vance uses false claims to blame shutdown on Democrats as White House touts imminent layoffs | First Thing
bullets: • The vice-president used false claims to blame Democrats for the government shutdown
• The White House has warned that furloughs are imminent
• The crisis has higher stakes than previous shutdowns, with Trump racing to slash government departments
• About 750,000 federal employees are expected to be placed on furlougough, an enforced leave

items.title: How America fell behind China in the lunar space race—and how it can catch back up
bullets: • NASA's interim administrator, Sean Duffy, has been giving interviews and speeches around the world, offering a singular message: "We are going to beat the Chinese to the Moon" Privately, many people within the space industry and even at NASA, acknowledge that the US space agency appears to be holding a losing hand

items.title: ‘We are the last hope’: Gen Z Madagascar vows to fight on until president resigns
bullets: • The unrest broke out on 25 September when local councillors were arrested for protesting against water and electricity outages in the capital, Antananarivo
• The youth-led protests quickly spread to other towns and cities, fuelled by social media and other “Gen Z protests in Indonesia and Nepal, where the government was toppled

items.title: Hamas military leader in Gaza objects to ceasefire plan, BBC understands
bullets: • Izz al-Din al-Haddad is thought to believe the plan was designed to finish Hamas, whether the group accepts it or not
• US President Donald Trump's 20-point framework to end the war stipulates that Hamas disarm and have no role in governing Gaza

items.title: White House says layoffs 'imminent' with no end to shutdown in sight
bullets: • White House says mass layoffs of federal workers are 'imminent' with no end to shutdown in sight
• Government shutdown began on Wednesday, after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree a new spending plan
• The next vote to try and end the situation will not be held until Friday

items.title: Tokenization of real world assets is an unstoppable ‘freight train’ coming to major markets: Robinhood CEO
bullets: • A tokenized asset is a digital representation of a real-world asset, like stocks, or commodities, that can be recorded and traded on a blockchain or distributed ledger
• In June, the U.S
• began offering more than 200 tokenized U.K
• stocks to the European market

items.title: VIDEO: Trump's tariffs, changing markets and what an uncertain economy means for you
bullets: • President Trump promised to fuel an economic boom with a magic bullet: tariffs
• They're taxes added to a wide range of imports and money is coming in, more than $30 billion a month
• It's unclear what the larger impact of these tariffs will have on the economy
• Despite that, the president keeps promising to roll out new ones

items.title: Pressure on Democrats grows to end shutdown. And, Gaza City receives evacuation orders
bullets: • White House budget director, Russ Vought, announces $8 billion for energy projects in 16 states, all of which are considered blue states
• Vice President JD Vance has warned that federal workforce layoffs will happen if the shutdown continues
• Government services, like Social Security payments and Medicaid, are expected to be unaffected by the shutdown

items.title: 5 takeaways from NPR's investigation into the role of distribution lines in LA fires
bullets: • NPR's investigation into the role of distribution lines in the Eaton fire in Los Angeles
• The Eaton fire destroyed more than 9,000 buildings and led to 19 deaths in January
• NPR found that high power transmission lines were not the only kind of electrical equipment that caused problems

items.title: In Trump country, a Democrat critiques Trump — and talks of succeeding him
bullets: • Andy Beshear has twice won election as governor of Kentucky
• He is considering a run for president
• He spoke in an all-platform interview with NPR's Up First podcast and Morning Edition
• He says Trump owns any damage from the government shutdown

items.title: Research, curriculum and grading: new data sheds light on how professors are using AI
bullets: • Georgia State University professor G
• Sue Kasun uses Google's AI chatbot to come up with ideas for a new course
• Kasun is one of an increasing number of higher education faculty using generative AI models in their work
• About 40% of administrators and 30% of instructions use AI daily or weekly

items.title: Furloughs, closures and mass firings threats: What's next in the shutdown fight
bullets: • The effects of a government shutdown are rippling across the U.S
• Yesterday, federal workers stayed home from work and national parks prepared to close down
• White House officials and Congressional leaders spent the day pointing blame in public while a small group of lawmakers in the Senate began talks about a potential deal

items.title: Air traffic controllers helped end the last government shutdown, and may again
bullets: • There was only a "slight increase" in sick leave at two facilities in Virginia and Florida that handle high-altitude traffic
• With another government shutdown underway, U.S
• airlines are bracing for the possibility of delays and disruptions to commercial aviation

items.title: Remembering Jane Goodall: Legendary primatologist dies at age 91
bullets: • Remembering Jane Goodall: Legendary primatologist dies at age 91
• Her studies of wild chimpanzees transformed our understanding of apes
• Goodall's studies helped us learn more about apes than we thought of them
• She died Wednesday at 91

items.title: Meet the Arc spacecraft: it aims to deliver cargo anywhere in the world in an hour
bullets: • A new spacecraft company, Inversion, revealed its new "on demand" delivery vehicle Wednesday evening
• The company said it is building the Arc spacecraft to provide a capability to the US military to deliver as much as 500 pounds of supplies almost anywhere in the world, almost instantaneously

items.title: Saturn’s icy moon Enceladus just revealed stunning new clues to life
bullets: • Analysis of Cassini data has revealed new complex organic molecules inside ice grains spewing from Enceladus
• This is a clear sign that complex chemical reactions are taking place within the moon's underground ocean
• Scientists now believe the moon could be habitable, and plans are underway for a European mission to sample its surface and jets

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: Meet the woman steering Biden's bipartisan winning streak on Capitol Hill
bullets: • The White House has a long list of issues facing the nation's first two years of Congress
• President Barack Obama and his staff are working on a bipartisan agenda
• They say it's important to keep the public eye on what's happening in the U.S

items.title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
bullets: • Arizona Sen
• Kyrsten Sinema has always been a thorn in the Democrats side during her time in Congress
• She voted against her party more than almost any other member of Congress
• Now, the Democratic caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents

items.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
bullets: • President Andry Rajoelina has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts
• The UN says 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured in three days of demonstrations
• Thousands of people have marched in the capital Antananarivo since demonstrations began last week

items.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
bullets: • The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in Namibia's north, on 22 September
• The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park was to blame
• It said 49 soldiers were being deployed to fight the fires and a further 500 on Sunday

items.title: Scared of spiders? Some former arachnophobes now are keeping jumping spiders as pets
bullets: • Thousands of jumping spiders are being flooded with requests from people who want to keep them as pets
• Social media videos of the spiders' antics have been viewed millions of times on YouTube
• Some women are trying to overcome their fear of spiders, while others are simply enchanted by their unexpected cuteness

items.title: T-Mobile’s satellite service now supports Google Maps, WhatsApp, X, and more
bullets: • T-Mobile’s satellite-to-cell service now supports WhatsApp, Google Maps, X, AccuWeather, and more
• The Starlink-powered “T-Satellite” service lets users stay connected without cellular coverage
• The service already provides connectivity to native apps on select iPhone, Pixel, and Samsung phones

items.title: HP’s new 49-inch curved ultrawide monitor has a pop-up webcam
bullets: • The HP Series 5 Pro 49-inch Conferencing Monitor uses a 32:9 VA IPS panel with 5120 x 1440 resolution, 165Hz refresh, and an 1800R curvature
• It sports a hidden 5-megapixel webcam that extends from its top when you push to unlock it
• While the panel goes up to 165Hz and covers 99 percent of the sRGB color space, its 5ms response time and 8-bit color depth make it less than ideal for gaming

items.title: Music’s biggest labels are weeks away from major AI licensing deals
bullets: • Music's biggest labels are weeks away from major AI licensing deals
• Universal Music and Warner Music are pushing for a streaming-inspired payment model
• Talks are underway with tech heavyweights like Google and Spotify and AI startups including Klay Vision, ElevenLabs, and Stability AI

items.title: Trump admin adds banner attacking ‘Radical Left Democrats’ to government websites
bullets: • The Trump administration has put up banners across federal websites blaming Democrats for the government shutdown

• One banner on the US Department of Agriculture’s site says, “The Radical Left Democrats shut down the government” The White House website similarly includes a timer showing how long the shutdown has lasted so far

items.title: Apple sidelines lighter Vision Pro to prioritize smart glasses
bullets: • Apple is speeding up work on smart glasses that would compete with similar offerings from Meta
• The company may not release its first pair of smart glasses until 2027, putting it well behind Meta
• Apple is also halting plans for a lighter Vision Pro headset, Bloomberg reports

items.title: CNN Political Briefing
bullets: • CNN Political Director David Chalian takes you inside the latest developments with insight and analysis from the key players in politics
• Suzan DelBene (D-WA) is laser-focused on re-capturing the House in 2026
• The race for New Jersey governor could be the sleeper contest of the year
